meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of pragmatism.
meanings.sent1: Her pragmatistic approach to problem-solving focused on practical solutions.
meanings.sent2: The team's success was due to their pragmatistic mindset in tackling challenges.
meanings.sent3: The pragmatistic cat decided to use a cardboard box as a cozy bed.
meanings.sent4: His pragmatistic view of life was like seeing the world through clear glasses.
meanings.sent5: The pragmatistic decision to take the shorter route saved them time and energy.

meanings.definition: A person who adheres to or advocates pragmatism.
meanings.sent1: As a pragmatistic, she always sought practical solutions to problems.
meanings.sent2: The pragmatistic believed in focusing on what works best in reality.
meanings.sent3: The pragmatistic joked that the best way to fix a leaky faucet was with duct tape.
meanings.sent4: He was a true pragmatistic, always finding the most efficient way to complete tasks.
meanings.sent5: The pragmatistic's motto was 'Keep it simple and get it done.'

meanings.definition: The belief that practical consequences and real-world outcomes are the most important factors in decision-making.
meanings.sent1: Her pragmatistic led her to choose the most cost-effective option.
meanings.sent2: In business, a pragmatistic values results over theoretical ideals.
meanings.sent3: The pragmatistic's idea of a fun weekend was organizing their closet.
meanings.sent4: The pragmatistic approach to gardening focused on low-maintenance plants.
meanings.sent5: His pragmatistic nature made him a reliable decision-maker in times of crisis.
